ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: His eye did not waver nor did he look away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Neither did sight falter nor exceed the bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: His eye did not waver, nor did it stray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad's) eyes did not deceive him, nor did they lead him to falsehood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The sight did not shift, nor did it cross the limits.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The sight turned not aside, nor it transgressed beyond the limit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The eye did not turn aside, nor did it exceed the limit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: his eye swerved not; nor swept astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The eye turned not aside nor yet was overbold.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: His sight did not waver nor was it unduly bold.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The sight turned not aside, nor it exceeded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: His gaze did not swerve, nor did it overstep the bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (His) sight never swerved, nor did it go wrong!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The sight (of Prophet Muhammad SAW) turned not aside (right or left), nor it transgressed beyond (the) limit (ordained for it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: his eyes did not swerve, nor did they stray
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The sight did not waver, nor did it exceed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The sight [of the Prophet] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:17] The eye did not swerve, on the part of the Prophet (s), nor did it go beyond [the bounds], that is to say, his gaze did not turn away from the object of vision designated for it, nor did it go beyond that [object] on that night.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The eye turned not aside) the sight of Muhammad (pbuh) did not turn right or left because of what he saw (nor yet was overbold) due to what he saw; he saw that Gabriel had 600 wings.
